title: The change that transformed Hungaroring from Mickey Mouse to magnificent
summary: The twisting, dusty asphalt of Hungaroring rarely made for exciting racing until a layout tweak in the early 2000s set it on a path to being one of F1's best-loved venues

qa_pairs.question: What significant change occurred at the Hungaroring in the early 2000s?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: A layout tweak was made to improve racing.
wrong_options: The race was moved to a new location.
The circuit was repaved with new asphalt.
A chicane was added to the final sector.

qa_pairs.question: What was the reputation of the Hungaroring before the layout changes?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: It was considered to have boring and unexciting racing.
wrong_options: It was known for its high-speed straights.
It was a favorite among drivers for its technical challenge.
It had the highest average speeds in F1.

qa_pairs.question: Which characteristic of the Hungaroring was highlighted before its transformation?
wrong_options: Its long straights and high-speed corners.
The presence of multiple overtaking zones.
